channel.title: Morning Defense
channel.description: From the SitRoom to the E-Ring, the inside scoop on defense, national security and foreign policy.

item.title: To strike or not to strike
item.dc:creator: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: Coalition of the shilling: Trump’s Board of Peace
item.description: Some two dozen member countries joined the first meeting of the Board of Peace in Washington today with more than $16 billion in financial pledges.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow, Eli Stokols and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow, Eli Stokols and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Indonesia’s president has an offer for Trump
item.description: Indonesia’s President Prabowo Subianto is in Washington this week to show he’s all-in for President Donald Trump’s Board of Peace.
item.dc:creator: By Phelim Kine and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Phelim Kine and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Barrack’s close Epstein ties draw little fire
item.description: U.S. Ambassador to Turkey and special envoy to Syria TOM BARRACK had a yearslong friendship with convicted sex offender JEFFREY EPSTEIN, but their ties have not generated the same firestorm as others in Trump’s orbit.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: At Munich, a world order that ‘no longer exists’
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Venezuela state of play: Oil over elections
item.description: Five weeks post-Operation Absolute Resolve and Venezuela is no closer to democratic elections.
item.dc:creator: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing, Eric Bazail-Eimil and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing, Eric Bazail-Eimil and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: ‘Stay the course’ pleads ex-NATO chief
item.description: The former Danish prime minister who deployed his country’s troops to fight alongside American forces in Iraq and Afghanistan is in Washington this week with a message: We’re still friends.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Inside Seoul’s bid for Canada submarine contract
item.description: Here in this city of nearly 10 million souls, submarine building deals would hardly seem top of mind for most people.
item.dc:creator: By Catherine Kim, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Catherine Kim, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: Ukraine’s Christianity pitch wins MAGA traction
item.description: Ukraine is leaning into its Christianity as it presses its case in Washington, saying common bonds of faith mean the two nations should strengthen their ties.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Capitol Hill is losing patience with Taipei
item.description: Amid a funding scramble and debates over DHS, Capitol Hill has also been wading into Taiwan’s internal politics this week.
item.dc:creator: By Phelim Kine, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Phelim Kine, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: New START is dead. Trump wants a new-er deal.
item.description: The New START treaty died today, thus ending the last major U.S.-Russian arms control pact.
item.dc:creator: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: How Israel is navigating its next bid for US funding
item.description: Israel is beginning its push for its next long-term security deal with the U.S., and adjusting the type of defense commitments it’s looking for.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Ukraine makes its case to Trump’s Congress
item.description: Ukraine and its allies launched an advocacy week on Capitol Hill today, and got a warm welcome.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Could a Castro become our man in Havana?
item.description: President Donald Trump keeps suggesting the U.S. could negotiate an end to the regime in Havana.
item.dc:creator: By Eric Bazail-Eimil, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Eric Bazail-Eimil, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: Trump’s Taiwan retreat
item.description: Over the past few weeks, the Trump administration has gone quiet on Taiwan’s relevance to the U.S. defense strategy in the Indo-Pacific.
item.dc:creator: By Phelim Kine, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Phelim Kine, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: Trump’s brash foreign policy casts pall on ‘Pax Silica’
item.description: The Trump administration has launched a global tech supply chain partnership, arguing it will benefit many U.S. allies. But those allies are giving a mixed response.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Syria’s government consolidation sparks ‘mixed feelings’
item.description: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa is poised to dismantle Kurdish-led armed forces without objections from the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: How China’s military purge could help the Pentagon
item.description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping’s removal of two of China’s most senior military leaders last week could boost Pentagon efforts to counter China’s growing military muscle in the Indo-Pacific.
item.dc:creator: By Phelim Kine and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Phelim Kine and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: ICE tactics could freeze natsec funding
item.description: The killing of 37-year-old nurse Alex Pretti in Minnesota by federal agents over the weekend seems likely to stall national security spending legislation as the Senate heads towards a showdown.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Plans in flux on Cuba regime change
item.description: President Donald Trump has indicated that he believes the Cuban regime's days are numbered.
item.dc:creator: By Eric Bazail-Eimil and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Eric Bazail-Eimil and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Don’t expect Venezuela 2.0 with Iran
item.description: Despite all of President Donald Trump's saber-rattling this month, a repeat performance of his Venezuela operation against Iran is looking increasingly unlikely.
item.dc:creator: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: In Gaza, Board of Peace ‘only game in town’
item.description: The Board of Peace continues to gather members, with Saudi Arabia, Egypt, Jordan, Indonesia, Pakistan, Qatar and the United Arab Emirates among the latest to join.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Trump’s Former Denmark envoy: NATO is the US
item.description: Of all the reasons why critics say the U.S. shouldn’t take over Greenland, the threat to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization stands out as a particularly existential one for the post-WWII world order.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: A dispatch from the Denmark codel
item.description: Your host caught up with Pennsylvania Democratic Rep. Madeleine Dean about the view from a congressional visit to Denmark.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow

item.title: Machado’s Hill backers pray she passes Trump test
item.description: As President Donald Trump hosted Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado at the White House today, her longtime supporters on the Hill hoped that the meeting would encourage Trump to elevate her to power in Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing, Eric Bazail-Eimil and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing, Eric Bazail-Eimil and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: In Gaza, it's Blair to the Future
item.description: A divisive figure from the Middle East's past is returning to play a role in setting up Gaza's new government.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Winners and losers in an Iran strike
item.description: President Donald Trump said today he’d canceled meetings with Iranian leaders and pledged that “help is on its way” to the protesters who have thronged the streets against the regime and sustained some 2,000 casualties.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: What happened to Graham’s Russia sanctions?
item.description: It’s been nearly a week since Sen. LINDSEY GRAHAM (R-S.C.) announced that he got the go-ahead from the White House on his Russia sanctions package.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: The benefit to Beijing from Trump's Maduro op
item.description: The Trump administration’s seizure of Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro for alleged links to fentanyl trafficking could have a surprising after-effect — less pressure on China to curb its output of chemicals used to make the same drug.
item.dc:creator: By Phelim Kine and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Phelim Kine and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Syria and Israel take baby steps to detente
item.description: In a joint statement with the U.S. on Tuesday, Israel and Syria said they agreed to “reaffirm their commitment to strive toward achieving lasting security and stability arrangements.”
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
